FuncDef: The display service deactivate-record command displays service deactivation records.
CLIs: display service deactivate-record [ bod | daa | edsg ] [ time <begin-time> <end-time> [ date <begin-date> <end-date> ] | user-id <user-id> | policy-name <policy-name> ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the time that the device began to record the information.
The format is hh:mm:ss, where hh ranges from 0 to 23 and mm ranges from 0 to 59.

Specifies the time that the device stopped to record the information.
The format is hh:mm:ss, where hh ranges from 0 to 23 and mm ranges from 0 to 59.

Specifies the date that the device began to record the information.
The format is YYYY/MM/DD, standing for year/month/day.

Specifies the date that the device stopped to record the information.
The format is YYYY/MM/DD, standing for year/month/day.

Specifies the user ID.
The value is an integer and it ranges from 0 to 3145727.

Specifies the name of the service policy.
The value is a string and it ranges from 1 to 200 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display service deactivate-record command is used for troubleshooting. When a service is deactivated, you can use this command to check the record and get the information about when the service started and when it became deactivated and the reason for it.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
